channel.title: Posts on A Hugo website
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on A Hugo website

item.title: PCA - R version
item.description: library(tidyverse) library(knitr) opts_chunk$set(engine.path = '/anaconda3/bin/python') Load proteomics data The sample dataset is dim(scan) matrix. scan = read.csv('/Users/DL/Documents/Jupyter project/Somascan Protein Creatinine/somascan.csv') X = (scan[,c(4:35)]) # Scale and center - z score -- column wise xscale = (apply(X, 2, scale)) plot(attr(scale(X), "scaled:center")) x <- xscale[, 4] y <- xscale[, 5] z <- xscale[, 30] Distance dist() computes and returns distance matrix for pairwise samples stored in the rows of data matrix.

item.title: Git basics
item.description: Online tutorial for Git Some basic commands Add-commit-push git add -u :/ # adds all modified file changes to the stage; analgus to get files monitored by git. git add * :/ # adds modified and any new files (that’s not gitignore’ed) to the stage git commit -m ‘your commit comment’ # equivalent to save the file git commit -am ‘your commit comment’ # perform add and commit git push origin master # or just git push origin master Check history git status # consistency status with branch master, changes not staged for commit, untracked file.

item.title: Principle component analysis vs support vector machine
item.description: Background This spreadsheet contains urine proteomic data normalized to creatinine (relative fluorescent units of protein per mg of creatinine) with 4 groups: 1) Febrile UTI), 2) nonfebrile UTI, 3) culture negative pyuria (white blood cells in the urine) and 4) culture negative normal UA We are looking for a panel of protein/creatinine levels that predicts UTI (group 1 and 2 combined) when compared to both culture negative pyuria (group 3) and culture negative, normal UA (group 4) individually and in combination

item.title: A brief introduciton on intialization of a website using the R blogdown package
item.description: An useful short video introdution/guide is provided here.The website will be hosted by github webiste and administered using Netfily.com server. Some basic background knowledges may involve: Markdown syntax Github account Git1 Git2 Blogdown Set up a new repository on github The Github.com is where you will upload and store all the static documents for your website. Suppose you have already set up a github account. The creation of a new repository is straightforward, nothing other than inputting some basic repository info.
